prompt: <description>**Part 1: A rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** First, let's create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. Next, we will create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. This sketch will define the profile of the prism. 1. Draw a line from point (0, 0) to point (0.75, 0). 2. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0) to point (0.75, 0.0116). 3. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.0116) to point (0.75, 0.0736). 4. Draw a line from point (0.75, 0.0736) to point (0.7034, 0.0736). 5. Draw a line from point (0.7034, 0.0736) to point (0.7034, 0.0247). 6. Draw a line from point (0.7034, 0.0247) to point (0.6382, 0.0247). 7. Draw a line from point (0.6382, 0.0247) to point (0.6382, 0.0736). 8. Draw a line from point (0.6382, 0.0736) to point (0.1118, 0.0736). 9. Draw a line from point (0.1118, 0.0736) to point (0.1118, 0.0247). 10. Draw a line from point (0.1118, 0.0247) to point (0.0466, 0.0247). 11. Draw a line from point (0.0466, 0.0247) to point (0.0466, 0.0736). 12. Draw a line from point (0.0466, 0.0736) to point (0.0, 0.0736). 13. Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0736) to point (0.0, 0.0116). 14. Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0116) to point (0.0, 0.0). The sketch is now complete. Notice that there are no circles or arcs, only lines. Also, each loop is closed. Now, we need to scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Next, we will transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. However, in this case, the euler angles are all zero and the translation vector is also zero, so no transformation is needed. Finally, we will extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0098 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is zero. The sketch scale is 0.75. The operation is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation", which means a new solid body will be created. The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is also 0.75 units, and the height is 0.0098 units. With these instructions, a junior CAD designer should be able to generate an accurate CAD model of this part.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.1125, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Create face 1 and sketch on it. Start with a line drawn from point 0.0, 0.0 to point 0.525, 0.0. 3. Continue sketching by adding line 2, starting from point 0.525, 0.0 and ending at point 0.525, 0.1689. 4. Add line 3, from point 0.525, 0.1689 to point 0.0, 0.1689. 5. Complete the sketch by drawing line 4 from point 0.0, 0.1689 back to starting point 0.0, 0.0. Extrusion: 1. Using a sketch scale of 0.525, extrude the sketch by depth 0.15 in the normal direction. Part 2 Instructions Shape: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Create face 1 and sketch on it. Begin the sketch by drawing a line from point 0.0, 0.0 to point 0.1125, 0.0. 3. Continue the sketch with line 2, going from point 0.1125, 0.0 to point 0.1125, 0.1689. 4. Add line 3, starting at point 0.1125, 0.1689 and ending at point 0.0, 0.1689. 5. Finish the sketch by drawing line 4 from point 0.0, 0.1689 back to the starting point 0.0, 0.0. 6. Now, create a new sketch on a plane perpendicular to the previous sketch. Sketch a circle centered at point 0.375, 0.0845 and with a radius of 0.0813. Extrusion: 1. Join the current body to preceding CAD model by extruding the circular sketch. Scale the sketch by 0.75 and extrude it by 0.066 in the normal direction. Measurements: Part 1 has a length of 0.525, width of 0.525, and height of 0.15. Part 2 has a length of 0.75, width of 0.75, and height of 0.066. The final shape dimensions are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and a height of 0.5 units with a curved side having a radius of 0.5 units.</description>

Create a new sketch on face 1 of the new coordinate system. Similar to Part 1, the sketch contains two loops, loop 1 and loop 2, and each loop contains a single circle. Loop 1 has circle 1 with center at 0.375, 0.375 and radius 0.375. Loop 2 has circle 1 with center at 0.375, 0.375 and radius 0.27. After creating the sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same euler angles and translation vector as Part 1. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a reflective surface and a slightly tapered top and bottom. The height, width, and length of the final shape and all intermediate parts are provided in the description.</description>

Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a distance of `0.0938` units to create the 3D model. The height of this intermediate part is `0.6094` units.
